alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Burlington; Camden; Gloucester (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 1:52PM EDT until August 12 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Atlantic County in southern New Jersey... Southern Camden County in southern New Jersey... East central Gloucester County in southern New Jersey... Southwestern Burlington County in southern New Jersey... * Until 230 PM EDT. * At 151 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Turnersville, or 12 miles south of Gloucester City, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Glassboro, Lindenwold, Hammonton, Clayton, Berlin, Shamong, Chesilhurst, Atco, Sicklerville, Williamstown, Atsion, Marlton Lakes, Turnersville, Monroe Township, Pine Hill, Clementon, Pine Valley and Blackwood. This includes Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 33 and 44. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
